title: Randy Meisner [Eagles] - first solo album - [1978].
description:
Randy Meisner 

It is no surprise that Randy Meisner&#039;s first solo album sounds a great deal like an offshoot of the Eagles work, as it was recorded not long after he quit after a six-year stint. The songs run between the extremes of fluid, guitar-driven rockers and ballads draped in flowing lyricism with harmony singing contributions from his one-time teenage bandmate Donny Ullstrom. Apart from a somewhat dullish rendition of "Save the Last Dance for Me," the album works well, particularly a soulful and highly personalized rendition of "Take It to the Limit." 
Guitarists Jerry Swallow and Steve Edwards, pianist John Hobbs, bassist Kerry Morris, and drummer Kelly Shanahan make a good band, and Ernie Watts contributes a beautifully understated sax solo on "I Really Want You Here Tonight." "Every Other Day" sounds like a lost Eagles number, and "Heartsong" lives up to its title, ending the album on a deeply introspective note.

Enjoy, please comment and seed.
